item.title: Abby add a quote by Marthe Troly-Curtin
item.description: "Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time." -- Marthe Troly-Curtin

item.title: Abby add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For it would seem - her case proved it - that we write, not with the fingers, but with the whole person. The nerve which controls the pen winds itself about every fibre of our being, threads the heart, pierces the liver." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Abby add a quote by St. Augustine
item.description: "The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page." -- St. Augustine

item.title: Abby add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "Like all great travellers, I have seen more than I remember and remember more than I have seen." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Abby add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Abby add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "A story was a form of telepathy. By means of inking symbols onto a page, she was able to send thoughts and feelings from her mind to her reader's. It was a magical process, so commonplace that no one stopped to wonder at it." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Abby add a quote by Paul Theroux
item.description: "Travel is glamorous only in retrospect." -- Paul Theroux

item.title: Abby add a quote by Judith Thurman
item.description: "Every dreamer knows that it is entirely possible to be homesick for a place you've never been to, perhaps more homesick than for familiar ground." -- Judith Thurman

item.title: Abby add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Don't you like to write letters? I do because it's such a swell way to keep from working and yet feel you've done something." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Abby add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Pay heed to the tales of old wives. It may well be that they alone keep in memory what it was once needful for the wise to know." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Abby add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Abby add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "Always be a poet, even in prose." -- Charles Baudelaire
